description.narrative: The objective of this intervention are as following; 1. To improved distribution and increased variety of agriculture-enhancing inputs for small-scale farmers 2. To impove the targeting and verification of FISP beneficiary farmers. 3. To have the exact number of farmers accessing FISP visa cards in pilot districts
The Swedish support to Zambia National Farmers Union will get additional support through this initiative that aims to develop and implement a E-voucher system for small-scale farmers.

Zambias regering har sedan 2002 drivit Farmer Input Support Programme (FISP) som ger små-bönder tillgång till subventionerade jordbruksprodukter (såsom frön). FISP ämnar att påverka en mängd utvecklingsfaktorer positivt för småbönders hushåll såsom ökad jordbruksproduktivitet, ökade inkomster, livsmedelssäkerhet och nutrition. FISP har positivt påverkat Zambias småbönder, framförallt inom majsodling. En av de stora flaskhalsarna i projektet har varit distributions modellen av jordbruks "input" som varit både dyr, o-flexibel och ineffektiv. Ministry of Agriculture and Livestock, med ZNFU som implementerande part, implementerar nu en E-voucher pilot som använder VISA kort som småbönder kan använda för att få tillgång till sina subventionerade varor. Systemet väntas öka flexibiliteten, minska kostnaden, öka effektiviteten och göra processen av FISP distribution bättre på flera plan. Givarsamfundet har under flera år fört en dialog med regeringen för att få igenom denna metod som även var en av rekommendationerna i en utvärdering av FISP 2009. Piloten väntas nå 241 000 småböder i 13 Zambiska distikt ( Kalamo, Choma, Monze, Mazabuka, Chongwe, Mumbwa, Chibombo, Kabwe, Kapiri, Ndola, Chisamba, Pemba och Chikanta).Målet är att senare skala upp systemet till resterande distrikt och täcka de 900,000 personer som är del av FISP.

description.narrative: The cooperation with ZNFU has been challenging and complex due to the corruption scandal related to the Embassy's other core support to ZNFU which was detected during the implementation period. The electronic voucher system (E-voucher or eFISP) recorded the following results; - During the 2015/16/2017 season eFISP, crowded-in private sector participation in inputs distribution to rural farmers in the initial 13 pilot (2015/16 season) and later (2016/17season) 39 districts and reached approximately 25% of FISP beneficiaries. The FISP beneficiaries were estimated to be 1,500 smallholder farmers. - The number of agrodealers increased from 130 in the 13 districts to 422 in the 39 ditricts. Most of these agrodealers set up multiple shops accross districts, and agrodealer had more diverse products for farmers to choose from. As a result, most farmers were reportedly having access to inputs of their choice on time in nearby agro-dealer shops (a step towards diversification). - More than 2000 local jobs for youth were created. The jobs were mostly associated with agro-dealer shops where youth were employed as sales persons/agents. others even ended up owning shops. - The eFISP system enabled improved beneficiary identification, and managed to sort out over 7000 ghost farmers from the beneficiary register.
